faqs.question: Historical research e-resources- India
faqs.details: Which databases are good starting points for historical research on India?
faqs.answer:
Newspapers and Other News Media

The Times of India
Check Harvard availability
Harvard has access to this national newspaper out of Bombay back to 1861.

South Asian Newspapers 
South Asian Newspapers is one of the modules of the World Newspaper Archive. When complete, it will provide more than 400,000 fully searchable pages of newspapers published in South Asia dating from the 19th century. Content, made accessible on a rolling basis, will include titles published in India, Pakistan and Sri Lanka in English, Gujarati and Bengali.

Foreign Broadcast Information Service (FBIS) 
FBIS is a United States government agency which translates the text of daily radio and television broadcasts, newspapers and periodicals, government statements, books, and other sources of unrestricted information such as databases and gray literature from non-English sources around the world (46679 results for India). Reports with translations are issued for eight world regions daily and cover such topics as military affairs, politics, the environment, societal issues, economics, and science and technology. Readex will offer online access to daily reports for 1941-1996.

Periodicals

19th Century UK Periodicals Online, 1800-1900
Part 2 of this collection entitled "Empire" includes journals related to the expansion of the British empire published in Britain, India, Canada, South and East Africa, Canada, Australia and New Zealand.

Digitized Archives and Manuscripts and Print Resources

Foreign Office Files for India, Pakistan, and Afghanistan, 1947-1980, Part I: 1947-1964"
Representing the DO 133, DO 134, FO 371 and FCO 37 files from The National Archives, Kew, this online collection consists of the British Government's files on the countries of South Asia from shortly before Indian partition and independence up to 1980. The collection will eventually consist of three sections: 
Section I: Independence, Partition and the Nehru Era, 1947-64 
Section II: South Asian Conflicts and Independence for Bangladesh, 1964-71 
Section III: Afghanistan and the Cold War, Emergency Rule in India, and the Resumption of Civilian Rule in Pakistan, 1972-80

India, Raj and Empire
Diaries, letters, maps, sketches and official and private papers relating to the East India Company's activities in India date from before 1857 (when the area came under direct rule of the British government) and from 1857 to 1947. Topics covered in varying depth include social history, urban history, trade, wars, agriculture, travel and antiquities, and Indian and Imperial politics.

Making of the Modern World, 1450-1800
Facsimile images of 61,000 works of literature on economic and business published from 1450 through 1850. Strongly represented in the collection are works critical to the study of the East India Company. It combines the selected material from two pre-eminent collections -- the Kress Collection of Business and Economics at the Baker Library Historical Collections, Harvard Business School and the Goldsmiths' Library of Economic Literature at the University of London Library. Full-text searching on more than 12 million pages provides researchers unparalleled access to this vast collection of material on commerce, finance, social conditions, politics, trade and transport.

faqs.question: India - Industry specific research
faqs.details: Where can I find industry associations or organizations for India?
faqs.answer:
Agriculture

Topics: Agriculture
Brings together agriculture related government information including statistics, technology, resource management, etc.

Auto

Automotive Component Manufacturers Association of India
Site includes statistics on the industry and a directory of Indian automotive manufacturers.

Automotive Advisory Service
Ernst & Young's India subsidiary offers a few reports on this page. Some are on the site, others must be requested.

Energy

Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Site includes regulations, reports and statistics on the sector.

Health Care

India Knowledge@Wharton: Health Economics
Articles on the health care system and industry in India.

World Health Organization - Countries - India
Includes basic health statistics and descriptions of several health related issues in India.

Ministry of Health & Family Welfare
Good source for information on healthcare policy and efforts of the national government to improve access to healthcare.

WHO India
The site of the World Health Organization office in India, includes information on diseases and agency activities.

Information Technology

Internet & Mobile Association of India 
Trade association site includes research reports on internet related topics such as online advertising.

Manufacturers Association for Information Technology 
Association for the Indian IT, Communications Technology and electronics hardware manufacturing industries, the site includes industry statistics and a directory of members that can be searched by product/component.

MediaNama: News & Analysis of Digital Media in India
Covers internet, telecom, and mobile communication and apps. Features business news and analysis of policy.

NASSCOM
NASSCOM is a national trade association for software, services and business process outsourceing. The web site allows one to browse for companies (an online directory with advanced search capabilities can be purchased) and includes presentations on initiatives (eg: green IT, diversity) and tables of contents and executive summaries of research reports.

Media

Ministry of Information and Broadcasting
Includes decisions, regulations etc. relating to radio and television broadcasting, film, and other media outlets.

TAM Media Research
The company measures television, radio and internet audiences. Summary data is available free on the site. In the past the company has been amenable to providing custom data to HBS faculty. Contact the India Research Center for more information.

Mining and Metals Manufacturing

Joint Plant Committe
A government sponsored entity that collects data on Indian steel production and trade. Articles on steel are also available.

Textiles

Ministry of Textiles
Government ministry promotes the textile industry. Site includes information about commercial policy, developments in various sectors of the industry and production and price information.

Telecom

Cellular Operators Association of India
The web site of the New Delhi based trade association includes industry statistics, position and technology papers and a list of service providers.

Telecom Regulatory Authority of India 
Regulations and statistics regarding broadcast and cable, landline, wireless, and internet access.

faqs.question: Supply Chain: business strategies
faqs.answer:
• ABI/ProQuest - provides articles and reports from industry and academic publication on the topic. 
  • Business Source Complete - Provides articles from industry and academic publications on the topic. It includes full-text of Harvard Business Review and abstract of HBS cases
  • IBISWorld - provides industry market reports. Limited to US, UK, China, Australia, and global.

faqs.question: News sources- India
faqs.details: Where can I can find business news specific to India?
faqs.answer:
Daily News Sources:

Bloomberg TV India
This YouTube channel features business videos from Bloomberg India.

Business Line
Business news and analysis from The Hindu.

Business Standard
Daily business newspaper and website.

Economic Times
Major business news source includes market data, company financials, IPO information and more.

Financial Express
Check Harvard availability
Daily financial newspaper. The website is slow, but the paper is also available through Factiva.

India Real Time
A Wall Street Journal blog that includes guest commentators and occasional new stories from the Indian press.

LiveMint.com
Wall Street Journal's Indian publication.

Times of India
Harvard has access to this news publication goes back to 1861. Check Harvard availability.

Magazines, Blogs and other news sources:

McKinsey Quarterly: India
A collection of articles from McKinsey on India.

India Knowledge@Wharton
Produced at the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School, the newsletter includes articles in the areas of Finance and Investment, Leadership and Change, Marketing, Insurance and Pensions, Health Economics, Strategic Management, Real Estate, Law and Public Policy, Human Resources, Business Ethics, Innovation and Entrepreneurship, Operations Management, and Managing Technology.

Business Today
Check Harvard availability
A general business magazine published in New Delhi. Harvard's holdings go back to 1994. The web site includes articles from the current issue and back to 1996, financial information and features such as the BT 500 and Best "B" Schools.

Business World
Check Harvard availability
Weekly business publication out of Calcutta. The publication's web site includes full text of current and archived issues, sections on the economy, finance, science & technology, and case studies. RSS available.

Business & Economy
A general business magazine out of India (coverage is not excusively on Indian business). The web site has archives back to July, 2005. Print copies are available from the Center for Research Libraries (via interlibrary loan).

Economic & Political Weekly
Publication of the Sameeksha Trust, features research and comentary on contemporary Indian society. The most current four issues are available for free. See also Harvard availability

Inclusion
Semimonthly online magazine devoted to inclusive economic development.

Outlook Business 
Includes thought pieces in addition to news. Often issues feature a theme.

VC Circle 
News, information and analysis on Indian finance, private equity and venture capital.

faqs.question: Annual IT expeditures by industry
faqs.details: Annual reported IT expeditures by U.S. industry and by type of IT expenditure.
faqs.answer:
U.S. Census Bureau compiles an annual "Information and Communication Technology Survey" that breaks out IT spending by industry and type of expenditure.

http://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/icts.html

faqs.question: Pharmaceuticals: Drug sales data
faqs.details: Where can I find drug sales data and forecasts?
faqs.answer:
• Cortellis – allows to search for drug sales and drug sale forecasts by date range, drug name, etc.
  • Statista – provides quick facts on the topic.

faqs.question: IFC Resources: Ethiopia
faqs.details: Where can I find country, industry and market information and news about Ethiopia to help me with my IFC?
faqs.answer:
Industry and market research

  • Passport
  • Mintel Market Sizes
  • OneSource Global Business Browser - Datamonitor/MarketLine Industry Profiles:
    • Click on News & Reports in the blue bar at the top of the screen
    • On the next screen, uncheck the News box and then check the box for Market Research and Title Search
    • Enter the name of the country into the Keyword Search box.  You can also change the date range for reports.

Country information and data

  • World Development Indicators
  • Economist Intelligence Unit

 

 News

  • Factiva
  • EMIS
  • AllAfrica
